content.description: This is a hard sloping mantle. Start with your hands matched on the best section of the sloper. Mantle up and over with a high heel, using your entire body to get to the finishing sloper crack.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter are needed for this to be safe, as there is a ledge below that I somersaulted off.
content.location: It is in the Jumble, high up. It is the best route in it, I think. It is above the V0 warmup problem on the very obvious face.

content.description: This is a generally sunny area, and the rock dries very nicely. There is a very small selection of routes here, most of which are quite good. But since there is a 30 ft approach from the parking lot, it is worth checking them out.
